data.text: @brassoteach Slow and steady. I'm back up to 5k after nearly 8 months of building up from walking after a knee injury. You'll get there- just be patient and committed.
@Mel34804598 @brassoteach It’s horrible isn’t it. It takes so much of your life away - I’ve now been off work for 11 months. Hope things start to improve for you soon x
@brassoteach Maybe try Jeffing for a while. You can find info on YouTube if you need it, but basically it’s a mix of running/walking for specific time frames

@brassoteach I had Covid and then hurt my knee but found that couch to 5k just wasn't for me anymore. I alternated between slowly increasing my distance by just 0.1 mile each time and then only running 1 mile but trying to increase my speed. Since January I've gotten back to 4 miles.

@brassoteach Similar problem. I kept going by running half the distance (at most) to before and half the runs per week. It’s getting better but been like this since September. Sometimes I set off running, had to turn round and walk back. Don’t give up
@niceredbike2 @brassoteach I’ve had to give up my Pilates due to long Covid. Only have enough energy to work, eat and sleep. 😕
@brassoteach I struggled after Covid too. Like many others on here I did Couch to 5k- it gave me the structure and motivation I needed to overcome the physical effort of running again.

@brassoteach Check your breathing. Are you breathing into your belly or chest? How many times are you breathing? Should only be 12 times per minute. 
This is my long covid doctor’s advice. I didn’t even realise I was breathing wrong until he told me!
